intro: Oenothera scabra, commonly known as rough-leaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and yellow, tubular flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its medicinal and ornamental value. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and roadsides. Oenothera scabra is also noted for its ability to self-pollinate and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
